metadata.Title: CVE-2018-11782 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Apache Subversion versions up to and including 1.9.10, 1.10.4, 1.12.0, Subversion's svnserve server process may exit when a well-formed read-only request produces a particular answer. This can lead to disruption for users of the server. Ace Olszowka discovered that Subversion incorrectly handled certain svnserve requests. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause svnserver to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11782` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-svn - 1.9.3-2ubuntu1.3
libapache2-svn - 1.9.3-2ubuntu1.3
libsvn-java - 1.9.3-2ubuntu1.3
libsvn-perl - 1.9.3-2ubuntu1.3
libsvn-ruby1.8 - 1.9.3-2ubuntu1.3
libsvn1 - 1.9.3-2ubuntu1.3
python-subversion - 1.9.3-2ubuntu1.3
ruby-svn - 1.9.3-2ubuntu1.3
subversion - 1.9.3-2ubuntu1.3
subversion-tools - 1.9.3-2ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: subversion package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.3-2ubuntu1.3').
